sailpoint.object

Class RoleTarget

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.RoleTarget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject

    public class RoleTarget
extends AbstractXmlObject
    Holds information to track down a role assignment to an account.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setDisplayNameIfDifferent

        public void setDisplayNameIfDifferent(java.lang.String name)
        XML clutter hack. Set the display name if it is different than the native identity. These cannot be queried so it is not important that this always be in a column. Reduce clutter for the 99% of cases that are not directories.

      • isMatchingApplication

        public boolean isMatchingApplication(java.lang.String id,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String instance)
        Return true if this target matches an application reference. Have the usual complications to deal with unit test objects with missing database ids.

      • isMatch

        public boolean isMatch(RoleTarget other)

      • isMatch

        public boolean isMatch(RoleTarget other,
              boolean checkRoleName)
        Return true if this target matches another. First the application reference must match, then the nativeIdentity. The roleName is not used in the match. roleName is only set for targets that are stored inside RoleAssignments and duplicates have been dealt with. RoleTargets inside RoleDetections will not have roleNames but occasionally RoleDetection targets need to be compared to RoleAssignment targets.

      • isEqual

        public static boolean isEqual(java.util.List<RoleTarget> list1,
              java.util.List<RoleTarget> list2)
        Return true if one role target list is equal to another. They must both have the same targets in any order.

      • isCompatible

        public static boolean isCompatible(java.util.List<RoleTarget> list1,
                   java.util.List<RoleTarget> list2)
        Return true if the RoleTargets in the first list are all included in the second list. The second list might have more than is needed.

      • isMatch

        public static boolean isMatch(java.util.List<RoleTarget> list1,
              java.util.List<RoleTarget> list2)
        Return true if two RoleTarget lists are the same regardless of order.

      • fromEntitlementGroups

        public static java.util.List<RoleTarget> fromEntitlementGroups(java.util.List<EntitlementGroup> groups)
        Convert the EntitlementGroup model used by the correlator into the RoleTarget model used for persistence.

      • toEntitlementGroups

        public static java.util.List<EntitlementGroup> toEntitlementGroups(Resolver r,
                                                   java.util.List<RoleTarget> targets)
                                                            throws GeneralException
        Convert a list of RoleTargets objects into a list of EntitlementGroups. Have to pass a Resolver since EntitlementGroup needs an Application reference.

        Used when this needs to be converted back to the older EntitlementGroup model

        Throws:
        GeneralException
